identification.cap: 0.98-1.97 inches, convex with sunken center, orangey-brown, dry rough/scaly, flesh whitish thin no stain.
identification.teeth: Whitish to light brown, 5-7 mm long, fragile, break easily.
identification.stem: 0.98-2.36 inches tall, 0.20-0.39 inches thick, slender centrally attached, cream-buff, bruises dull orange.

habitat: Coniferous forests (pines, hemlocks), wetter areas, eastern North America, mid-summer to late fall.
